name: Social Dominance Orientation Scale
description: A 16-item measure of individual differences in preference for group-based hierarchy and inequality. Includes two subdimensions: Dominance (active subjugation) and Anti-Egalitarianism (opposition to equality).
reference: Ho, A. K., Sidanius, J., Kteily, N., Sheehy-Skeffington, J., Pratto, F., Henkel, K. E., Foels, R., & Stewart, A. L. (2015). The nature of social dominance orientation: Theorizing and measuring preferences for intergroup inequality using the new SDO7 scale. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 109(6), 1003-1028.
instructions: Show how much you favor or oppose each idea below. You can work quickly; your first feeling is generally best.

questions.name: sdo7_1
questions.description: An ideal society requires some groups to be on top and others to be on the bottom.

questions.name: sdo7_2
questions.description: Some groups of people are simply inferior to other groups.

questions.name: sdo7_3
questions.description: No one group should dominate in society.

questions.name: sdo7_4
questions.description: Groups at the bottom are just as deserving as groups at the top.

questions.name: sdo7_5
questions.description: Group dominance is a poor principle.

questions.name: sdo7_6
questions.description: We should not push for group equality.

questions.name: sdo7_7
questions.description: We shouldn't try to guarantee that every group has the same quality of life.

questions.name: sdo7_8
questions.description: It is unjust to try to make groups equal.

questions.name: sdo7_9
questions.description: We should work to give all groups an equal chance to succeed.

questions.name: sdo7_11
questions.description: Having some groups on top really benefits everybody.

questions.name: sdo7_12
questions.description: It's probably a good thing that certain groups are at the top and others are at the bottom.

questions.name: sdo7_13
questions.description: All groups should be given an equal chance in life.

questions.name: sdo7_14
questions.description: We would have fewer problems if groups were treated more equally.

questions.name: sdo7_15
questions.description: Superior groups should dominate inferior groups.

questions.name: sdo7_16
questions.description: Inferior groups should stay in their place.
